meanings.definition: The quality of lacking a definite shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The amorphousness of the cloud made it difficult to predict its next move.
meanings.sent2: The artist intentionally created amorphousness in her abstract painting.
meanings.sent3: The amorphousness of the jello amused the children as they tried to catch it with their spoons.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts swirled in a state of amorphousness, unable to take a clear shape.
meanings.sent5: The amorphousness of the ghostly figure sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: The state of being shapeless or formless.
meanings.sent1: The amorphousness of the fog obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The amorphousness of the blob made it hard to identify what it was.
meanings.sent3: The amorphousness of the slime toy entertained the kids for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were a swirling amorphousness, impossible to pinpoint.
meanings.sent5: The amorphousness of the shadow seemed to stretch and contort in the dim light.
